metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8086 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Race condition in the ext4_file_write_iter function in fs/ext4/file.c in the Linux kernel through 3.17 allows local users to cause a denial of service (file unavailability) via a combination of a write action and an F_SETFL fcntl operation for the O_DIRECT flag. Dmitry Monakhov discovered a race condition in the ext4_file_write_iter function of the Linux kernel's ext4 filesystem. A local user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (file unavailability).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8086` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.16.0-26-generic - 3.16.0-26.35~14.04.1
linux-image-3.16.0-26-generic-lpae - 3.16.0-26.35~14.04.1
linux-image-3.16.0-26-lowlatency - 3.16.0-26.35~14.04.1
linux-image-3.16.0-26-powerpc-e500mc - 3.16.0-26.35~14.04.1
linux-image-3.16.0-26-powerpc-smp - 3.16.0-26.35~14.04.1
linux-image-3.16.0-26-powerpc64-emb - 3.16.0-26.35~14.04.1
linux-image-3.16.0-26-powerpc64-smp - 3.16.0-26.35~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-3.16.0-26-generic - 3.16.0-26.35~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-3.19.0-18-generic - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-18-generic-lpae - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-18-lowlatency - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-18-powerpc-e500mc - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-18-powerpc-smp - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-18-powerpc64-emb - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-18-powerpc64-smp - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-3.19.0-18-generic - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.04 preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support apw> looks like the end if the discussion above on the ext4 list points to changes proposed in https://lkml.org/lkml/2014/10/18/63, unsure if they are sufficient either. this was applied with a different subject line

criterions.comment: linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-lts-utopic package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.16.0-26.35~14.04.1').
linux-lts-vivid package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1').
linux-maguro: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-manta: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
